org.jpac

Class Queue<T>

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.jpac.Queue<T>
  • Type Parameters:
    T - type of the items to queue

    public class Queue<T>
extends java.lang.Object
    a queue is useful in cases, where one producing module has to convey asynchronously produced items to one consuming module

    • Method Detail

      • enqueue

        public void enqueue(T item)
             throws SignalAccessException,
                    InconsistencyException
        used to enqueue an item to the queue. Can only be called by the producing module.
        Parameters:
        item -
        Throws:
        SignalAccessException - queue accessed by
        InconsistencyException

      • dequeue

        public T dequeue()
          throws SignalAccessException
        used to dequeue an item from the queue. Can only be called by the consumer module (Provided, that it seized this queue before).
        Throws:
        SignalAccessException

      • peek

        public T peek()
       throws SignalAccessException
        used to retrieve the head item of the queue without removing it.
        Throws:
        SignalAccessException

      • isFull

        public boolean isFull()
               throws SignalAccessException
        queue contains 'maxSize' items. No further items can be enqueued until items are dequeued
        Returns:
        true = queue is full
        Throws:
        SignalAccessException

      • isEmpty

        public boolean isEmpty()
                throws SignalAccessException
        queue contains no items. No further items can be dequeued until new items are enqueued
        Returns:
        true = queue is empty
        Throws:
        SignalAccessException

      • containsItems

        public boolean containsItems()
                      throws SignalAccessException
        queue contains items. Subsequent dequeue(), peek() operations will succeed
        Returns:
        true = queue contains items
        Throws:
        SignalAccessException

      • getSize

        public int getSize()
            throws SignalAccessException
        Returns:
        size of the queue depending of the module calling it: producer: can not be less than the size of the queue at the beginning of the cycle and increases by one on every successful enqueue() operation. consumer: can not be greater than the size of the queue at the beginning of the cycle and decreases by one on every successful dequeue() operation
        Throws:
        SignalAccessException

      • notEmpty

        public ProcessEvent notEmpty()
        Returns:
        a process event which will be fired, as soon as the queue contains at least one item

      • notFull

        public ProcessEvent notFull()
        Returns:
        a process event which will be fired, as soon as the queue is able to receive at least one new item

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object
